verses.kjv: Be ye followers of me, even as I also am of Christ.
verses.web: Be imitators of me, even as I also am of Christ.
verses.ct: Follow my example, just as I follow the example of Christ.

verses.kjv: Now I praise you, brethren, that ye remember me in all things, and keep the ordinances, as I delivered them to you.
verses.web: Now I praise you, brothers, that you remember me in all things, and hold firm the traditions, even as I delivered them to you.
verses.ct: I'm proud of you, brothers and sisters, for remembering me in everything and holding on to the traditions exactly as I passed them on to you.

verses.kjv: But I would have you know, that the head of every man is Christ; and the head of the woman is the man; and the head of Christ is God.
verses.web: But I would have you know that the head of every man is Christ, and the head of the woman is man, and the head of Christ is God.
verses.ct: But I want you to understand this: Christ is the head of every man, man is the head of woman, and God is the head of Christ.

verses.kjv: Every man praying or prophesying, having his head covered, dishonoureth his head.
verses.web: Every man praying or prophesying, having his head covered, dishonors his head.
verses.ct: Any man who prays or prophesies with his head covered dishonors his head.

verses.kjv: But every woman that prayeth or prophesieth with her head uncovered dishonoureth her head: for that is even all one as if she were shaven.
verses.web: But every woman praying or prophesying with her head uncovered dishonors her head. For it is one and the same thing as if she were shaved.
verses.ct: But any woman who prays or prophesies with her head uncovered dishonors her head — it's the same as if she had shaved it completely.

verses.kjv: For if the woman be not covered, let her also be shorn: but if it be a shame for a woman to be shorn or shaven, let her be covered.
verses.web: For if a woman is not covered, let her hair also be cut off. But if it is shameful for a woman to have her hair cut off or be shaved, let her be covered.
verses.ct: If a woman won't cover her head, she might as well cut her hair off. But if it's shameful for a woman to have her hair cut off or shaved, then she should cover her head.

verses.kjv: For a man indeed ought not to cover his head, forasmuch as he is the image and glory of God: but the woman is the glory of the man.
verses.web: For a man indeed ought not to have his head covered, because he is the image and glory of God, but the woman is the glory of the man.
verses.ct: A man shouldn't cover his head, because he is the image and glory of God. But the woman is the glory of the man.

verses.kjv: For the man is not of the woman; but the woman of the man.
verses.web: For man is not from woman, but woman from man;
verses.ct: After all, man didn't come from woman — woman came from man.

verses.kjv: Neither was the man created for the woman; but the woman for the man.
verses.web: for man wasn’t created for the woman, but woman for the man.
verses.ct: And man wasn't created for the woman's sake, but woman for the man's sake.

verses.kjv: For this cause ought the woman to have power on her head because of the angels.
verses.web: For this cause the woman ought to have authority over her own head, because of the angels.
verses.ct: For this reason, a woman should have a sign of authority on her head, because of the angels.

verses.kjv: Nevertheless neither is the man without the woman, neither the woman without the man, in the Lord.
verses.web: Nevertheless, neither is the woman independent of the man, nor the man independent of the woman, in the Lord.
verses.ct: Even so, in the Lord, woman is not independent of man, and man is not independent of woman.

verses.kjv: For as the woman is of the man, even so is the man also by the woman; but all things of God.
verses.web: For as woman came from man, so a man also comes through a woman; but all things are from God.
verses.ct: For just as woman came from man, every man is also born through a woman — and everything ultimately comes from God.

verses.kjv: Judge in yourselves: is it comely that a woman pray unto God uncovered?
verses.web: Judge for yourselves. Is it appropriate that a woman pray to God unveiled?
verses.ct: Think about it for yourselves: is it proper for a woman to pray to God with her head uncovered?

verses.kjv: Doth not even nature itself teach you, that, if a man have long hair, it is a shame unto him?
verses.web: Doesn’t even nature itself teach you that if a man has long hair, it is a dishonor to him?
verses.ct: Doesn't nature itself teach you that long hair on a man is a disgrace to him?

verses.kjv: But if a woman have long hair, it is a glory to her: for her hair is given her for a covering.
verses.web: But if a woman has long hair, it is a glory to her, for her hair is given to her for a covering.
verses.ct: But long hair on a woman is her glory, because her hair was given to her as a natural covering.

verses.kjv: But if any man seem to be contentious, we have no such custom, neither the churches of God.
verses.web: But if any man seems to be contentious, we have no such custom, neither do God’s assemblies.
verses.ct: If anyone wants to argue about this, we don't practice any other custom — and neither do any of God's churches.

verses.kjv: Now in this that I declare unto you I praise you not, that ye come together not for the better, but for the worse.
verses.web: But in giving you this command, I don’t praise you, that you come together not for the better but for the worse.
verses.ct: Now, on this next matter, I can't praise you at all. Your gatherings are doing more harm than good.

verses.kjv: For first of all, when ye come together in the church, I hear that there be divisions among you; and I partly believe it.
verses.web: For first of all, when you come together in the assembly, I hear that divisions exist among you, and I partly believe it.
verses.ct: First of all, I hear that when you come together as a church, there are divisions among you — and I believe at least some of it is true.

verses.kjv: For there must be also heresies among you, that they which are approved may be made manifest among you.
verses.web: For there also must be factions among you, that those who are approved may be revealed among you.
verses.ct: I suppose there have to be disagreements among you so that those who are genuine will stand out clearly.

verses.kjv: When ye come together therefore into one place, this is not to eat the Lord’s supper.
verses.web: When therefore you assemble yourselves together, it is not the Lord’s supper that you eat.
verses.ct: When you gather together, what you're eating is not really the Lord's Supper.

verses.kjv: For in eating every one taketh before other his own supper: and one is hungry, and another is drunken.
verses.web: For in your eating each one takes his own supper first. One is hungry, and another is drunken.
verses.ct: Because when it's time to eat, each of you rushes ahead with your own meal. One person goes hungry while another gets drunk.

verses.kjv: What? have ye not houses to eat and to drink in? or despise ye the church of God, and shame them that have not? What shall I say to you? shall I praise you in this? I praise you not.
verses.web: What, don’t you have houses to eat and to drink in? Or do you despise God’s assembly and put them to shame who don’t have enough? What shall I tell you? Shall I praise you? In this I don’t praise you.
verses.ct: Don't you have your own homes where you can eat and drink? Or do you have so little respect for God's church that you humiliate those who have nothing? What am I supposed to say to you? Should I praise you for this? Absolutely not.

verses.kjv: For I have received of the Lord that which also I delivered unto you, That the Lord Jesus the same night in which he was betrayed took bread:
verses.web: For I received from the Lord that which also I delivered to you, that the Lord Jesus on the night in which he was betrayed took bread.
verses.ct: Here is what I received from the Lord himself, and what I passed on to you: On the night he was betrayed, the Lord Jesus took bread.

verses.kjv: And when he had given thanks, he brake it, and said, Take, eat: this is my body, which is broken for you: this do in remembrance of me.
verses.web: When he had given thanks, he broke it and said, “Take, eat. This is my body, which is broken for you. Do this in memory of me.”
verses.ct: After giving thanks, he broke it and said, "Take and eat. This is my body, which is broken for you. Do this to remember me."

verses.kjv: After the same manner also he took the cup, when he had supped, saying, This cup is the new testament in my blood: this do ye, as oft as ye drink it, in remembrance of me.
verses.web: In the same way he also took the cup, after supper, saying, “This cup is the new covenant in my blood. Do this, as often as you drink, in memory of me.”
verses.ct: In the same way, after the meal he took the cup and said, "This cup is the new covenant sealed by my blood. Every time you drink it, do this to remember me."

verses.kjv: For as often as ye eat this bread, and drink this cup, ye do shew the Lord’s death till he come.
verses.web: For as often as you eat this bread and drink this cup, you proclaim the Lord’s death until he comes.
verses.ct: Every time you eat this bread and drink this cup, you are proclaiming the Lord's death until he comes back.

verses.kjv: Wherefore whosoever shall eat this bread, and drink this cup of the Lord, unworthily, shall be guilty of the body and blood of the Lord.
verses.web: Therefore whoever eats this bread or drinks the Lord’s cup in a way unworthy of the Lord will be guilty of the body and the blood of the Lord.
verses.ct: So anyone who eats this bread or drinks the Lord's cup in an unworthy manner will be guilty of sinning against the body and blood of the Lord.

verses.kjv: But let a man examine himself, and so let him eat of that bread, and drink of that cup.
verses.web: But let a man examine himself, and so let him eat of the bread, and drink of the cup.
verses.ct: Each person should examine themselves first, and then eat the bread and drink from the cup.

verses.kjv: For he that eateth and drinketh unworthily, eateth and drinketh damnation to himself, not discerning the Lord’s body.
verses.web: For he who eats and drinks in an unworthy way eats and drinks judgment to himself if he doesn’t discern the Lord’s body.
verses.ct: Because anyone who eats and drinks without recognizing the significance of the Lord's body eats and drinks judgment on themselves.

verses.kjv: For this cause many are weak and sickly among you, and many sleep.
verses.web: For this cause many among you are weak and sickly, and not a few sleep.
verses.ct: That's why so many of you are weak and sick, and a number of you have died.

verses.kjv: For if we would judge ourselves, we should not be judged.
verses.web: For if we discerned ourselves, we wouldn’t be judged.
verses.ct: If we examined ourselves honestly, we wouldn't come under judgment.

verses.kjv: But when we are judged, we are chastened of the Lord, that we should not be condemned with the world.
verses.web: But when we are judged, we are punished by the Lord, that we may not be condemned with the world.
verses.ct: But when the Lord does judge us, he disciplines us so that we won't be condemned along with the rest of the world.

verses.kjv: Wherefore, my brethren, when ye come together to eat, tarry one for another.
verses.web: Therefore, my brothers, when you come together to eat, wait for one another.
verses.ct: So, my brothers and sisters, when you come together to eat, wait for each other.

verses.kjv: And if any man hunger, let him eat at home; that ye come not together unto condemnation. And the rest will I set in order when I come.
verses.web: But if anyone is hungry, let him eat at home, lest your coming together be for judgment. The rest I will set in order whenever I come.
verses.ct: If anyone is really hungry, eat at home first — so that when you gather, it doesn't bring judgment on you. I'll sort out the other matters when I arrive.
